syllabus:
**NTNU General English 3:  English for Education** – **Spring semester, 2022**

**Instructor:**  Kyle Lai 賴國維               

**Email:** [kuoweilai@ntnu.edu.tw](mailto:kuoweilai@ntnu.edu.tw)

**Class time:** Friday, periods 3-4 / 10:20 a.m. - 12:10 p.m., 公館 Ｓ202, 16 weeks

**Course description**

This course aims to enhance students’ abilities to share and explore ideas in a wide range of issues in English. These themes include psychology, communication, and language learning through TED-Ed videos. Active discussion and participation in the related topics each week will be required. Students will learn to hone their critical thinking skills, as well as developing their spoken and written communication in English.

**Course objectives**

1.  Build confidence in expressing oneself and communicating in English
2.  Expand one’s knowledge in a variety of subjects that can be applied in learning and education
3.  Learn new vocabulary to enhance one’s word knowledge
4.  Develop teamwork skills to interact and share ideas with peers

**Course requirements**

Weekly tasks

*   You are required to watch the assigned TED-Ed video before class. Also, **please bring a copy of the transcript** to class on that week (You may print it out, have it on your phone or laptop/tablet). 
*   Complete the **Google form** _before class_ (Individual work):

1) **Write down a sentence** that you find interesting or relatable

2) **Give your reasons** for choosing that sentence

*   Fill in the **discussion sheet** _in class_ (Group work):

1.  **Write down the answers** to the questions raised by the presenting group
2.  **Hand in the sheet** at the end of the class

Group presentation

*   The group presenting that week should:

1.  **Give a summary** of the video
2.  **Select** **at least five words** from the video to teach the class
3.  **Prepare two questions** related to the video for classmates to discuss
4.  **Present your own opinion or perspective** on the topic

Final project (TBA)

**This course will be conducted in English. Furthermore, students may need a good command in English for discussion and peer interaction.** Please see if this course fits your needs before selecting.
